title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 149-1.5 - Annual report
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 §§ 149-1.5 - Annual report

State Regulations
(a) Each school
district and community school district in the city of New York that is required
to submit a comprehensive district plan to the commissioner pursuant to section
149-1.3
(a) of this

Part shall submit to the commissioner an annual report in a form and at a time
prescribed by the commissioner. Such report shall provide data, individually
for each school providing services in accordance with this Subpart, and shall
include, but not be limited to, the following: (1)
the unduplicated number of pupils in each
grade who received compensatory instruction and services in accordance with the
provisions of this Subpart in mathematics, reading, and writing in the base
year with subtotals for pupils of limited English proficiency; (2)
the total number of years individual
pupils have received remedial instruction at the conclusion of the base year in
accordance with the provisions of this Subpart and in accordance with the
provisions of other State or Federal programs; (3)
the number of pupils, by grade, who
received instruction and services in accordance with the provisions of this

Subpart in the base year and who will be retained in the same grade in the
current year; (4)
expenditures in
the base year from the setaside for pupils with compensatory educational needs, and expenditures from other State and Federal compensatory programs as
determined by the commissioner; and
(5)
an evaluation of the results of the
execution of the district plan and an evaluation of each schoolwide
project. (b) Each school
district that is required to submit a district plan to the commissioner
pursuant to section
149-1.3
(b) of this

Part shall submit to the commissioner a complete annual report in a form and at
a time prescribed by the commissioner. Such report shall include, but not be
limited to the following: (1)
a description
of the expenditure of the base year's setaside for compensatory education for
eligible pupils; (2)
the number of
pupils with compensatory educational needs served in the programs and how they
were identified as pupils having such needs; and
(3)
an evaluation of the results obtained
from the operation of such programs. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8
§§
149-1.5

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
